verses.verse: And it came <WH1961> to pass, that when Isaac <WH3327> was old, <WH2204> and his eyes <WH5869> were dim, <WH3543> so that he could not see, <WH7200> he called <WH7121> Esau <WH6215> his oldest <WH1419> son, <WH1121> and said <WH559> to him, My son: <WH1121> and he said <WH559> to him, Behold, <WH2009> here am I.
And he said, <WH559> Behold <WH2009> now, <WH4994> I am old, <WH2204> I know <WH3045> not the day <WH3117> of my death: <WH4194>

Now therefore take, <WH5375> I pray <WH4994> you, your weapons, <WH3627> your quiver <WH8522> and your bow, <WH7198> and go <WH3318> out to the field, <WH7704> and take <WH6679> me some venison; <WH6720>
And make <WH6213> me savoury <WH4303> meat, such as I love, <WH157> and bring <WH935> it to me, that I may eat; <WH398> that my soul <WH5315> may bless <WH1288> you before <WH2962> I die. <WH4191>

And Rebekah <WH7259> heard <WH8085> when Isaac <WH3327> spoke <WH1696> to Esau <WH6215> his son. <WH1121> And Esau <WH6215> went <WH3212> to the field <WH7704> to hunt <WH6679> for venison, <WH6718> and to bring <WH935> it.

And Rebekah <WH7259> spoke <WH559> to Jacob <WH3290> her son, <WH1121> saying, <WH559> Behold, <WH2009> I heard <WH8085> your father <WH1> speak <WH1696> to Esau <WH6215> your brother, <WH251> saying, <WH559>
Bring <WH935> me venison, <WH6718> and make <WH6213> me savoury <WH4303> meat, that I may eat, <WH398> and bless <WH1288> you before <WH6440> the LORD <WH3068> before <WH6440> my death. <WH4194>
Now therefore, my son, <WH1121> obey <WH8085> my voice <WH6963> according to that which <WH834> I command <WH6680> you.

Go <WH3212> now to the flock, <WH6629> and fetch <WH3947> me from there <WH8033> two <WH8147> good <WH2896> kids <WH1423> of the goats; <WH5795> and I will make <WH6213> them savoury <WH4303> meat for your father, <WH1> such as he loves: <WH157>
And you shall bring <WH935> it to your father, <WH1> that he may eat, <WH398> and that he may bless <WH1288> you before <WH6440> his death. <WH4194>
And Jacob <WH3290> said <WH559> to Rebekah <WH7259> his mother, <WH517> Behold, <WH2005> Esau <WH6215> my brother <WH251> is a hairy <WH8163> man, <WH376> and I am a smooth <WH2509> man: <WH376>

My father <WH1> peradventure <WH194> will feel <WH4959> me, and I shall seem <WH1961> <WH5869> to him as a deceiver; <WH8591> and I shall bring <WH935> a curse <WH7045> on me, and not a blessing. <WH1293>
And his mother <WH517> said <WH559> to him, On me be your curse, <WH7045> my son: <WH1121> only <WH389> obey <WH8085> my voice, <WH6963> and go <WH3212> fetch <WH3947> me them.
And he went, <WH3212> and fetched, <WH3947> and brought <WH935> them to his mother: <WH517> and his mother <WH517> made <WH6213> savoury <WH4303> meat, such as his father <WH1> loved. <WH157>

And Rebekah <WH7259> took <WH3947> goodly <WH2530> raiment <WH899> of her oldest <WH1419> son <WH1121> Esau, <WH6215> which were with her in the house, <WH1004> and put <WH3847> them on Jacob <WH3290> her younger <WH6996> son: <WH1121>
And she put <WH3847> the skins <WH5785> of the kids <WH1423> of the goats <WH5795> on his hands, <WH3027> and on the smooth <WH2513> of his neck: <WH6677>
And she gave <WH5414> the savoury <WH4303> meat and the bread, <WH3899> which <WH834> she had prepared, <WH6213> into the hand <WH3027> of her son <WH1121> Jacob. <WH3290>
And he came <WH935> to his father, <WH1> and said, <WH559> My father: <WH1> and he said, <WH559> Here <WH2009> am I; who <WH4310> are you, my son? <WH1121>

And Jacob <WH3290> said <WH559> to his father, <WH1> I am Esau <WH6215> your first born; <WH1060> I have done <WH6213> according as you bade <WH1696> me: arise, <WH6965> I pray <WH4994> you, sit <WH3427> and eat <WH398> of my venison, <WH6718> that your soul <WH5315> may bless <WH1288> me.

And Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> to his son, <WH1121> How <WH4100> is it that you have found <WH4672> it so quickly, <WH4116> my son? <WH1121> And he said, <WH559> Because <WH3588> the LORD <WH3068> your God <WH430> brought <WH7136> it to me.

And Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> to Jacob, <WH3290> Come <WH5066> near, <WH5066> I pray <WH4994> you, that I may feel <WH4184> you, my son, <WH1121> whether you be my very <WH2088> son <WH1121> Esau <WH6215> or not.

And Jacob <WH3290> went <WH5066> near <WH5066> to Isaac <WH3327> his father; <WH1> and he felt <WH4959> him, and said, <WH559> The voice <WH6963> is Jacob's <WH3290> voice, <WH6963> but the hands <WH3027> are the hands <WH3027> of Esau. <WH6215>
And he discerned <WH5234> him not, because <WH3588> his hands <WH3027> were hairy, <WH8163> as his brother <WH251> Esau's <WH6215> hands: <WH3027> so he blessed <WH1288> him.
And he said, <WH559> Are you my very <WH2088> son <WH1121> Esau? <WH6215> And he said, <WH559> I am.

And he said, <WH559> Bring <WH5066> it near <WH5066> to me, and I will eat <WH398> of my son's <WH1121> venison, <WH6718> that my soul <WH5315> may bless <WH1288> you. And he brought <WH5066> it near <WH5066> to him, and he did eat: <WH398> and he brought <WH935> him wine <WH3196>and he drank. <WH8354>
And his father <WH1> Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> to him, Come <WH5066> near <WH5066> now, <WH4994> and kiss <WH5401> me, my son. <WH1121>

And he came <WH5066> near, <WH5066> and kissed <WH5401> him: and he smelled <WH7306> the smell <WH7381> of his raiment, <WH899> and blessed <WH1288> him, and said, <WH559> See, <WH7200> the smell <WH7381> of my son <WH1121> is as the smell <WH7381> of a field <WH7704> which <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> has blessed: <WH1288>
Therefore God <WH430> give <WH5414> you of the dew <WH2919> of heaven, <WH8064> and the fatness <WH4924> of the earth, <WH776> and plenty <WH7230> of corn <WH1715> and wine: <WH8492>

Let people <WH5971> serve <WH5647> you, and nations <WH3816> bow <WH7812> down <WH7812> to you: be lord <WH1376> over your brothers, <WH251> and let your mother's <WH517> sons <WH1121> bow <WH7812> down <WH7812> to you: cursed <WH779> be every one that curses <WH779> you, and blessed <WH1288> be he that blesses <WH1288> you.

And it came <WH1961> to pass, as soon <WH834> as Isaac <WH3327> had made an end <WH3615> of blessing <WH1293> Jacob, <WH3290> and Jacob <WH3290> was yet <WH389> scarce gone <WH3318> out from the presence <WH6440> of Isaac <WH3327> his father, <WH1> that Esau <WH6215> his brother <WH251> came <WH935> in from his hunting. <WH6718>

And he also <WH1571> had made <WH6213> savoury <WH4303> meat, and brought <WH935> it to his father, <WH1> and said <WH559> to his father, <WH1> Let my father <WH1> arise, <WH6965> and eat <WH398> of his son's <WH1121> venison, <WH6718> that your soul <WH5315> may bless <WH1288> me.
And Isaac <WH3327> his father <WH1> said <WH559> to him, Who <WH4310> are you? And he said, <WH559> I am your son, <WH1121> your firstborn <WH1060> Esau. <WH6215>

And Isaac <WH3327> trembled <WH2729> very <WH1419> exceedingly, <WH1419> and said, <WH559> Who? <WH4310> where <WH645> is he that has taken <WH6679> venison, <WH6718> and brought <WH935> it me, and I have eaten <WH398> of all <WH3605> before <WH2962> you came, <WH935> and have blessed <WH1288> him? yes, <WH1571> and he shall be blessed. <WH1288>

And when Esau <WH6215> heard <WH8085> the words <WH1697> of his father, <WH1> he cried <WH6817> with a great <WH1419> and exceeding <WH3966> bitter <WH4751> cry, <WH6818> and said <WH559> to his father, <WH1> Bless <WH1288> me, even <WH1571> me also, <WH1571> O my father. <WH1>
And he said, <WH559> Your brother <WH251> came <WH935> with subtlety, <WH4820> and has taken <WH3947> away your blessing. <WH1293>

And he said, <WH559> Is not he rightly <WH3588> named <WH7121> <WH8034> Jacob? <WH3290> for he has supplanted <WH6117> me these <WH2088> two <WH6471> times: <WH6471> he took <WH3947> away my birthright; <WH1062> and, behold, <WH2009> now <WH6258> he has taken <WH3947> away my blessing. <WH1293> And he said, <WH559> Have you not reserved <WH680> a blessing <WH1293> for me?

And Isaac <WH3327> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559> to Esau, <WH6215> Behold, <WH2005> I have made <WH7760> him your lord, <WH1376> and all <WH3605> his brothers <WH251> have I given <WH5414> to him for servants; <WH5650> and with corn <WH1715> and wine <WH8492> have I sustained <WH5564> him: and what <WH4100> shall I do <WH6213> now <WH645> to you, my son? <WH1121>

And Esau <WH6215> said <WH559> to his father, <WH1> Have you but one <WH259> blessing, <WH1293> my father? <WH1> bless <WH1288> me, even <WH1571> me also, <WH1571> O my father. <WH1> And Esau <WH6215> lifted <WH5375> up his voice, <WH6963> and wept. <WH1058>

And Isaac <WH3327> his father <WH1> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559> to him, Behold, <WH2009> your dwelling <WH4186> shall be the fatness <WH4924> of the earth, <WH776> and of the dew <WH2919> of heaven <WH8064> from above; <WH5921>

And by your sword <WH2719> shall you live, <WH2421> and shall serve <WH5647> your brother; <WH251> and it shall come <WH1961> to pass when <WH834> you shall have the dominion, <WH7300> that you shall break <WH6561> his yoke <WH5923> from off <WH5921> your neck. <WH6677>

And Esau <WH6215> hated <WH7852> Jacob <WH3290> because <WH5921> of the blessing <WH1293> with which <WH834> his father <WH1> blessed <WH1288> him: and Esau <WH6215> said <WH559> in his heart, <WH3820> The days <WH3117> of mourning <WH60> for my father <WH1> are at <WH7128> hand; <WH7126> then will I slay <WH2026> my brother <WH251> Jacob. <WH3290>

And these words <WH1697> of Esau <WH6215> her elder <WH1419> son <WH1121> were told <WH5608> to Rebekah: <WH7259> and she sent <WH7971> and called <WH7121> Jacob <WH3290> her younger <WH6996> son, <WH1121> and said <WH559> to him, Behold, <WH2009> your brother <WH251> Esau, <WH6215> as touching you, does comfort <WH5162> himself, purposing to kill <WH2026> you.
Now <WH6258> therefore, my son, <WH1121> obey <WH8085> my voice; <WH6963> arise, <WH6965> flee <WH1272> you to Laban <WH3837> my brother <WH251> to Haran; <WH2771>
And tarry <WH3427> with him a few <WH259> days, <WH3117> until <WH5704> <WH834> your brother's <WH251> fury <WH2534> turn <WH7725> away;

Until <WH5704> your brother's <WH251> anger <WH639> turn <WH7725> away from you, and he forget <WH7911> that which <WH834> you have done <WH6213> to him: then I will send, <WH7971> and fetch <WH3947> you from there: <WH8033> why <WH4100> should I be deprived <WH7921> also <WH1571> of you both <WH8147> in one <WH259> day? <WH3117>

And Rebekah <WH7259> said <WH559> to Isaac, <WH3327> I am weary <WH6973> of my life <WH2416> because <WH6440> of the daughters <WH1323> of Heth: <WH2845> if <WH518> Jacob <WH3290> take <WH3947> a wife <WH802> of the daughters <WH1323> of Heth, <WH2845> such as these <WH428> which <WH834> are of the daughters <WH1323> of the land, <WH776> what <WH4100> good shall my life <WH2416> do me?
